page.title: 14BARNS GREEN ART EXHIBITION
page.content: THE {ART EXHIBITION}IS HELD AT THE VILLAGE HALL, AND WAS STARTED ABOUT 15 YEARS AGO. RETIRED ARMY OFFICERS, DOCTERS, NURSES, AND YOUNG CHILDREN EXHBIT THERE. THERE ARE BETWEEN 200 AND 700 PAINTINGS. 450 PAINTINGS ARE SHOWN AND HUNG UP.NOT ONLY PICTURES ARE SUBMITTED, POTTERY AND WOOD CARVINGS ARE SOLD.SOME ITEMS ARE SHOWN PURELY FOR INTEREST AND NOT TO BE SOLD. LOCAL SECONDARY SCHOOLS EXHIBIT THERE. ABOUT 6 SCHOOLS TAKE PART EVERY YEAR. A TROPHY IS GIVEN TO THE BEST PICTURE. A VILLAGE HALL COMITTEE RUNS THIS EVENT, AND HAVE MANY HELPERS TO STEWARD FOR 2 HOURS AT A TIME. SOME PROVIDING REFRESHMENTS WHILST OTHERS GIVE OUT PROGRAMES AND RAFFLE TICKETS.1 ITEM FROM THE EXHIBITION IS GIVEN FOR THE RAFFLE. THE PRICES OF EXHIBITS VARY GREATLY.THE MOST EVER PAID FOR A PAINTING WAS Â£150.
